channel.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
channel.description:
Ok for you people who have passed the game and want to help you can help you're fellow noobs here. I myself need some help its a little problem.
Ok I got the 3rd Mirror Shard I need one more. I restored Ilias memory and she talks about a women and the rod of sky or heavens. Where can I find this "women"?

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @Darth_Afro56 Darth_Afro56
item.description:
@Darth_Afro56 wrote:

[quote=“blacker, post:30, topic:41031”][quote author=Darth_Afro56 link=topic=57513.msg714297#msg714297 date=1167566490]

in the 2’nd room of the dungeon (think its biggest one) when you stop the fan above that room claw shot to the chain link ceiling above, then lower down until your in the room below, then you can see the brown ball, then claw shot to that brown ball then equipt the iron boots while dangling, that should activate the fan north of that room, thats pretty much it you should know after that, sorry if you dont understand i wrote it to the best of my ability

Thnx. And I beat the game. Sad ending I gotta admit.

Blacker: Try shotting the thin part of the stalactites remember the stalactites are the rocks on the cieling that look like drops of liquid.
[/quote] I know the stalactites are the rocks on the cieling… o and thanks for the tip… now I gotta find a way back to kakarikio village so I odn’t have to pay 90 rupees for freakin’ water boms…[/quote]
There are some chests in that room which give you water bombs.

[quote=“wuzbuz, post:29, topic:41031”][quote author=Darth_Afro56 link=topic=57513.msg714323#msg714323 date=1167567087]
I personally like thinking but yeah, its easy to get stuck. :\ Btw, do you know how the hell do I get 100,000 ruppees to buy that magic armour?
[/quote]

you have to donate 3000 rupee to malo mart so they can build the bridge and buy out the fancy shop in castle town, then buy it for 598 rupees in the castle town branch of malo mart.[/quote]
Is the malo mart that poor old guy from the west road?

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @wuzbuz wuzbuz
item.description:
@wuzbuz wrote:

Darth_Afro56:

I personally like thinking but yeah, its easy to get stuck. :\ Btw, do you know how the hell do I get 100,000 ruppees to buy that magic armour?

you have to donate 3000 rupee to malo mart so they can build the bridge and buy out the fancy shop in castle town, then buy it for 598 rupees in the castle town branch of malo mart.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @Darth_Afro56 Darth_Afro56

@Darth_Afro56 wrote:

I passed it with no game guide. But a few hints. And help. But what fun is a game like this with just reading a guide and doing what it says?!

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Just get the game guide, that’s what I have. But, when I was getting it, the guy told me that the gamecube version of the guide is interchangeable with the GC and the Wii, and then I find out all of the directions are opposite :. Not that big of a deal.

But ya, just get the game guide, it tells you everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @Darth_Afro56 Darth_Afro56
item.description:
@Darth_Afro56 wrote:

mvp566:

in the 2’nd room of the dungeon (think its biggest one) when you stop the fan above that room claw shot to the chain link ceiling above, then lower down until your in the room below, then you can see the brown ball, then claw shot to that brown ball then equipt the iron boots while dangling, that should activate the fan north of that room, thats pretty much it you should know after that, sorry if you dont understand i wrote it to the best of my ability

Thnx. And I beat the game. Sad ending I gotta admit.

Blacker: Try shotting the thin part of the stalactites remember the stalactites are the rocks on the cieling that look like drops of liquid.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

And I thought if I asked for help in these forums on Twilight Princess I’d get laughed at. I normally stick to Gamespot forums for this kinda stuff…[br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2006, 08:28:00 PM[/size][hr][quote=“ilyaostr9, post:18, topic:41031”][quote author=Darth_Afro56 link=topic=57513.msg708605#msg708605 date=1167477183]
I have it for GC but it really don’t matter the Game is the same. Same role ect.
[/quote]
Only east is west and west is east. The GC world is a mirror image of the Wii world[/quote] No, it’s the other way around. Traditionally, Link is a lefty, but in the Wii, they made it so Link is a righty, but the easiest way to do that was to reverse the entire game so they did. So basicly, the Wii version is a mirror image of the GC version, instead of the other way around…
And yes I have Twilight Princess, but I’m stuck in the second room of the Water Temple. I need help. I know I haave to shoot the Stalactites down with a bow and arrow-bomb combo, but they won’t go down, and I’m spending hours looking for rupees to pay for all these water bombs!

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Darth_Afro56:

I have it for GC but it really don’t matter the Game is the same. Same role ect.

Only east is west and west is east. The GC world is a mirror image of the Wii world

Read full topic

item.title: Official Twilight Princess Help thread
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

well it depends which mirror, which temple? there are 4 mirror shards

if you found 1-2 shards your about 50% done

if you found the 3-4 your about 60-75% maybe even 80% done, tell me exactly where you are and ill tell you more
